meta.title: Home - STEMCivics

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow hero-slideshow fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

div.p: STEMCivics opened in 2014 with 100 ninth graders. The same number of ninth graders was added each year until there were 400 students in the high school in 2017. In 2018, a middle school was opened.
We use STEM to inspire academic excellence, to promote civic engagement, and to ensure students are ready for college and career.
Every member of the Class of '18, our first class, graduated.

We offer a rigorous academic program in a nurturing environment. We know our students and our students know us. The atmosphere is familial in many ways. As students come to school more, they learn more, and they graduate.

p.b: An Incredible Array of Athletics Teams

div.p: In addition to the traditional sports such as soccer, volleyball, basketball, track and field, softball, etc., we offer equestrian, crew, archery, fencing, among other activities usually found only in elite private schools.

PURPLEfect Palace, in Ewing, is the high school site, where over 400 of the best kids ever enjoy learning everyday. At PURPLEfect Parc, the new middle school, in Trenton, more than 150 PURPLEfect people are setting the standards for future students.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList home-news fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_5

div.p: There's always something to celebrate in PURPLEfect Empire, and yesterday it was the quarterly Honor and Merit Rolls ceremony on the hallowed grounds of PURPLEfect Palace.

article.a: Read More about March 13, 2020: Celebrating Achievement

div.p: There's also something cool going on at the hallowed grounds of PURPLEfect Palace, and the best kids ever in the Class of '23 enjoyed learning about the unique properties of water.

article.a: Read More about March 6, 2020: Always Forming Bonds

div.p: The best kids ever are launching into learning in engineering at PURPLEfect Parc, as building catapults takes center launchpad.
Purple Lightning is ready to strike in the 2020 robotics season, which begins next month

article.a: Read More about Feb. 21, 2020: Robot Ready

div.p: Designing and building devices to deliver dropped eggs is a critical function for engineers.

article.a: Read More about Feb. 14, 2020: Defenestration, PURPLEfected!

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Due to the coronavirus, STEMCivics is operating as an online school AT LEAST THROUGH MAY 15. The high school and middle school campuses are currently closed, except for lunch pickup (10:30 a.m. - 12 p.m.). Students can access their lessons via Google Classroom.

Students must log on each day and complete assignments for credit. Parents and guardians are encouraged to check their email, this Web page, and the STEMCivics Facebook page for updates. Parents and guardians can monitor progress via the OnCourse parent portal.

Our Pandemic Management Plan is here. Effective April 2: New meal distribution days: Mondays and Thursdays only: HS 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.; MS 10:30 a.m - 12 p.m. We are distributing three days's of breakfast and lunch each day.

Parents and guardians should refer to communications sent via email on March 13 by Ms. Richardson and Ms. Slovich. Please email them (srichardson@stemcivics.org or kslovich@stemcivics.org) if you have further questions.
